name: Hunter Valley Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: I chose this B&B thanks to online reviews. It is hard to find fault with this B&B. Julie was warm and welcoming and full of great suggestions, such as the "Two Fat Blokes" half day winery tour as well as arranging us dinner at a nearby pub in Branxton which included a very convenient free minibus pick up and drop off service.
reviews.title: Great hospitality in a great location

reviews.text: The house has a real rural isolation to it making it peaceful and relaxing. You'll even spot kangaroos in the woodland as you come in through the driveway. Then I must mention "Mojo", the utterly adorable collie dog.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms and en-suite bathrooms are a little on the small side but they are spotlessly clean and well appointed, each room opening out onto the delightful wrap-around veranda.
reviews.title: Great setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Honeymoon hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have stayed twice now and we love it. The hospitality, the room and the breakfast are all fantastic. Julie the owner is very welcoming and she makes you feel like home. We are very thankful!
reviews.title: At last somewhere to come back to

aka: Hunter Valley Bed & Breakfast Greater Newcastle/Rothbury
